line_1: NEXT JOHNSON sat, — in ancient learning train'd,
line_2: His rigid judgment Fancy's flights restrain'd,

line_1: Whom in this solitude she careful train'd
line_2: One pledge of love her comfort still remain'd,

line_1: The son he wish'd might be to honour train'd;
line_2: Both would delay, the one, till — riches gain'd,

line_1: In sturdy boys to virtuous labours train'd;
line_2: A pride in honest fame, by virtue gain'd,
Whose hands with cruelty are stain'd,

line_1: What wonder if, to patient valour trained,
line_2: They guard with spirit what by strength they gained;

line_1: Like his own Children, Angiers Son was train'd,
line_2: And from his Patron's Bounty, Arms and Arts he gain'd.

line_1: True, I was not to virtue train'd,
line_2: By each offence my heart was pain'd,

line_1: True, I was not to virtue train'd,
line_2: My better thoughts my life disdain'd,
